attributes.action: Honour the 1971 England Women’s footballers and condemn the  FA for banning them
attributes.background: In 1971 Harry Batt took a team of women to play in the World Cup in Mexico. Women’s football had been banned by the FA following WWI as “quite unsuitable for females” (!) The team were fantastic ambassadors for this country and have been rightly described as the “lost lionesses”.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for people to be nominated for an honour.  

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here: 

https://www.gov.uk/honours
